DOC.brief_summary: The goal randomize clinical study ass pain dysfunction 225 volunteer subject chronic low back pain . The hypothesis study custom-made shoe improve patient ' low back pain dysfunction . Additionally , custom-made shoe orthotics plus chiropractic treatment improve patient ' low back pain dysfunction maintain improvement one year study follow-up period . Specific Aims : 1 . To determine change perceive pain level ( Numeric Pain Rating Scale ) dysfunction ( Oswestry Disability Index ) patient chronic low back pain six week custom-made shoe orthotic use without chiropractic care compare care . 2 . To determine change perceive pain level dysfunction patient chronic low back pain twelve week custom-made shoe orthotic use . 3 . To determine change perceive pain level dysfunction 3 , 6 , 12 month follow 12 week treatment period .
DOC.brief_title: Orthotic Use Chronic Low Back Pain
DOC.criteria: 1 . At least 18 year old 2 . Subjects must symptomatic current pain T12 SI joint without radiate pain average score 4 high NPRS scale 3 . Symptoms must present least three month 1 . Use custommade orthotics past 6 month 2 . Ongoing active conservative care ( physical therapy chiropractic care ) low back , leg , foot receive past 6 month ( exclude use oral medication daily athome exercise general wellbeing ) . 3 . Current future litigation healthcare concern 4 . Not fluent literate English language . We able provide multiple translator within study 5 . Brain disorder ( e.g. , dementia , Alzheimers Disease , etc . ) would lead difficulty questionnaire completion 6 . Chronic pain low back pain , fibromyalgia multiple sclerosis 7 . Clinically significant chronic inflammatory spinal arthritis 8 . Spinal pathology fracture 9 . Progressive neurologic deficit due nerve root spinal cord compression , include symptoms/signs cauda equina syndrome 10 . History bleed disorder 11 . Known arterial aneurysm 12 . Previous lumbar spine surgery 13 . Severe skeletal deformity foot 14 . Peripheral neuropathy due disorder diabetes 15 . Low back pain reproducible 16 . Current pregnancy 17 . Other condition may affect subject ' ability participate throughout duration study exclude patient participation study , include contraindication orthotic use chiropractic spinal manipulation
